pull.title: Add missing cs_wallet lock that triggers new lock held assertion
pull.body:
A new AssertLockHeld(cs_wallet) call was added in commit a58370e
"Dedup nTimeFirstKey update logic" (part of PR #9108).

The lock held assertion will fail when loading prexisting wallets files from
before the #9108 merge that have watch-only keys.

events.message:
Add missing cs_wallet lock that triggers new lock held assertion

A new AssertLockHeld(cs_wallet) call was added in commit a58370e
"Dedup nTimeFirstKey update logic" (part of PR #9108).

The lock held assertion will fail when loading prexisting wallets files from
before the #9108 merge that have watch-only keys.

events.body: This bug was found by @morcos. It should be tagged for 0.14 because it's a regression caused by #9108.

ACK 0f25026

seems like it might be better to just lock cs_wallet for the whole function call, but i don't know if there is some reason it wasn't written that way.

I don't see any reason, updated the PR. 0f25026b553771817928ceb96d33d1bab942e18c -> 07afcd6379bb46ace5856f6a47a9188cf9aed2ea ([loadlock.0](https://github.com/ryanofsky/bitcoin/commits/pr/loadlock.0) -> [loadlock.1](https://github.com/ryanofsky/bitcoin/commits/pr/loadlock.1))
